intro: Licania canescens, commonly known as the silky licania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks. Licania canescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
